main event: On 2/21/56 in Ventura, California, a business man named SHULL observed a self-luminous, white, round object at an estimated altitude of 6,000-7,000 feet, moving in a generally northerly direction.
interesting points: The object was observed for approximately 2-3 minutes and made no sound, leaving no trail.
It appeared to gain altitude, then descend, ruling out the possibility of it being a star or planet.
The object's self-luminous and maneuverable nature ruled out the possibility of it being a weather balloon.
The sighting was classified as UNIDENTIFIED due to the object's behavior and characteristics.
No further action was recommended based on the evaluation.
